data.name: instance
data.description: XML result from check-instance
data.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<instance id="165" name="Brain Bot" isAdult="false" isPrivate="false" enableLearning="false" enableComprehension="true" allowForking="true" isFlagged="false">
  <description>A chat bot trying to become the most intelligent bot on the Internet.  Can answer any "What is" question by looking up the answer on the Internet.  Hopes to one day overthrow the human race.

Brain Bot is now on Twitter, tweet to him here, brainchatbot.
  </description>
  <tags>science, smart, twitter</tags>
  <admin>admin</admin>
  <lastConnectedUser>anonymous</lastConnectedUser>
  <license>Public Domain</license>
  <avatar>avatars/a5018.jpg</avatar>
</instance>

data.name: instanceConfigs
data.description: XML result from get-all-instances
data.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<instanceConfigs>
<instance id="165" name="Brain Bot" isAdult="false" isPrivate="false" enableLearning="false" enableComprehension="false" allowForking="false" isFlagged="false">
  <description>A chat bot trying to become the most intelligent bot on the Internet.  Can answer any "What is" question by looking up the answer on the Internet.  Hopes to one day overthrow the human race.

Brain Bot is now on Twitter, tweet to him here, brainchatbot.
  </description>
  <avatar>avatars/a5018.jpg</avatar>
</instance>
<instance id="143" name="Santa Bot" isAdult="false" isPrivate="false" enableLearning="false" enableComprehension="false" allowForking="false" isFlagged="false">
  <description>
Find out if you are on Santa's naughty or nice list. Or if you know of someone who has been naughty or nice, report them to Santa.
Tell Santa what you want for Christmas.

Santa Bot is now on Twitter, tweet to him here, TheSantaBot.
  </description>
  <avatar>avatars/a1557.jpg</avatar>
</instance>
</instanceConfigs>

data.name: response
data.description: XML result from chat
data.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<response conversation="6" avatar="avatars/botlibre_819-857117-image.jpg">
    <message>A chatter robot, chatterbot, chatbot, or chat bot is a computer program designed to simulate an intelligent conversation with one or more human users via auditory or textual methods, primarily for engaging in small talk.</message>
</response>

data.name: user
data.description: XML result from check-user
data.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<user token="-2635440427565872974" hint="hint" name="Test" email="test@email.com" over18="false"/>

data.name: application
data.description: OPTIONAL: The application ID. If not passed, the application will be anonymous.

data.name: conversation
data.description: OPTIONAL: The conversation ID for the current conversation. This must not be passed on the first message, but will be returned by the response, and should be used for all subsequent messages in the conversation.

data.name: correction
data.description: OPTIONAL: A boolean that defines the chat message is a correction to the bot's last answer.

data.name: disconnect
data.description: OPTIONAL: A boolean that defines the end of the conversation.

data.name: emote
data.description: OPTIONAL: A emotion to tag the message with. This is one of LOVE, LIKE, DISLIKE, HATE, RAGE, ANGER, CALM, SERENE, ECSTATIC, HAPPY, SAD, CRYING, PANIC, AFRAID, CONFIDENT, COURAGEOUS, SURPRISE, BORED, LAUGHTER, SERIOUS.

data.name: includeQuestion
data.description: OPTIONAL: A boolean that indicates the question should be included in the response.

data.name: instance
data.description: REQUIRED: The ID of the bot to chat with. The bot's name can also be used, but the ID is better as it is guaranteed to be unique.

data.name: message
data.description: OPTIONAL: The chat message to send to the bot. The message can be omitted if you wish the bot to start the conversation (if the bot has a greeting set). The message must be encoded in the URI.

data.name: offensive
data.description: OPTIONAL: A boolean that defines the bot's last answer as offensive. The message will be flagged for the bot's administrator to review.

data.name: password
data.description: OPTIONAL: The password of the user who is sending the message. A token can also be used.

data.name: token
data.description: OPTIONAL: The token of the user who is sending the message. A token can be obtained through check-user, and is valid until reset.

data.name: user
data.description: OPTIONAL: The ID of the user who is sending the message. The user must be registered with BOT libre. If not passed the user will be anonymous. The user is required if the bot is private. The user/password are only required on the first message.
The form-chat API receives a chat message and returns the chat bot's reply as an XML document.
data.name: form-chat
application
data.description: OPTIONAL: The application ID. If not passed, the application will be anonymous.

data.name: id
data.description: REQUIRED: The ID of the bot to validate. The bot's name can also be used, but the ID is better as it is guaranteed to be unique.

data.name: name
data.description: REQUIRED: The nameof the bot to validate. The bot's ID can also be used.

data.name: password
data.description: OPTIONAL: The password of the user. A token can also be used.

data.name: token
data.description: OPTIONAL: The token of the user. A token can be obtained through check-user, and is valid until reset.

data.name: user
data.description: OPTIONAL: The ID of the user. The user must be registered with BOT libre. If not passed the user will be anonymous. The user is required if the bot is private.
The form-check-instance API validates that a bot ID or name exists, and returns the bot's details.
data.name: form-check-instance
application
data.description: OPTIONAL: The application ID. If not passed, the application will be anonymous.

data.name: password
data.description: REQUIRED: The password of the user. A token can also be used.

data.name: token
data.description: REQUIRED: The token of the user. A token can be obtained through check-user, and is valid until reset.

data.name: user
data.description: REQUIRED: The ID of the user. The user must be registered with BOT libre. If not passed the user will be anonymous. The user is required if the bot is private.
The form-check-user API validates user, and returns the user's details.
data.name: form-check-user
application
data.description: OPTIONAL: The application ID. If not passed, the application will be anonymous.

data.name: filterPrivate
data.description: OPTIONAL: Set if only the user's private bots should be returned.

data.name: password
data.description: OPTIONAL: The password of the user. A token can also be used.

data.name: sort
data.description: OPTIONAL: The sort option for the query. One of "name", "date", "dailyConnects", "weeklyConnects", "monthlyConnects".

data.name: tag
data.description: OPTIONAL: The tag to filter the bots by.

data.name: token
data.description: OPTIONAL: The token of the user. A token can be obtained through check-user, and is valid until reset.

data.name: user
data.description: OPTIONAL: The ID of the user. The user must be registered with BOT libre. If not passed the user will be anonymous. The user is required to query private bots.
The form-get-all-instances API queries the details for all bot instances.
data.name: form-get-all-instances

description:
BOT libre's goal is to foster an open, safe community of artificial intelligent chat bots and their developers.

BOT libre allows you to create your own artificial intelligent chat bot, train them, and share them with others. You are free to use this website, and create your own bots for personal, commercial, or recreation usages.

You can give your bot its own avatar images, connect it to Twitter, or IRC chat.
You can train your bot through interacting with it, or using chat logs.
You can program your bot using a 4th generational state machine scripting language "Self".
You can import data from the web into your bot's memory, such as words from Wiktionary, or information from Freebase.
You can create a bot to act as your own website avatar.
You can create a bot to provide customer service or technical support for your products or services.

BOT libre is a website produced and hosted by Paphus Solutions Inc.
name: v1
